content: **grønland headband** as in the hønsestrik fair isle knitting movement of the 1970s i have created motifs for the current struggle i often refer to hønsestrik as quiet activism it is a style of knitting that allows us to express our attitudes and wear them on our bodies as a clear signal to the outside world and it is precisely the fight for greenland and the rights of greenlanders that is close to my heart which i would like to support with this headband you will not receive a step-by-step pattern to follow as hønsestrik is all about playing freely with yarn and motifs so you should choose the motifs that are important to you but you are of course welcome to take inspiration from my headband you can also choose to find other motifs or perhaps insert text that expresses something you want to emphasise **in my book hønsestrik published by gyldendal 2025 you can find both alphabets and lots of other motifs ** **sizes** size s/m m/l circumference headband approx 50 56 cm the measurement equals approx 160 178 rounds in height width approx 11 cm with hønsestrik you are not told how much yarn and how many colours you will need this is not possible instead you will be told how much the design weighs which will give you an indication of the total amount of yarn required feel free to use leftovers from your stash **yarn** *i have used * pernilla 100 % wool 175 m/50 g by filcolana the multi-coloured headband in this quality weighs approx 60 g *i have used the following colours * pernilla chinese red col 218 pernilla raindrop melange col 819 pernilla natural white col 101 **recommended needles** dpns 3 5 mm - or a 3 5mm 80 cm circular needle for the magic loop method stitch markers **gauge** 24 stitches x 32 row in fair isle knitting on needle 3 5 mm = 10 x 10 cm measure your gauge swatch after washing - it applies to stockinette stitch and fair isle knitting remember that the needle size is just a recommendation
